text: animals are fascinating and there's no
better place to see them than right here
in the southern African bush in this
video I'm going to share with you some
interesting facts about 20 animals I've
spotted over the last few days in
Botswana in South Africa all clips
you're about to see were taken by myself
and my friend Willy who's got the giant
lens and most of the information is
provided by Bruce who's an expert guide
at eco training and he knows as much as
anyone about animals one elephant the
largest land animal on earth known for
their intelligence slit for a module
they are vegetarians and can eat up to
300 pounds of grass per day to draft the
tallest mammal on earth with necks that
can reach six feet long they can run as
fast as 35 miles per hour and have hair
covered horns called ossicones which
males use to fight each other
three zebra fast-moving animals found in
open plains their black and white coat
distract predators and disperses 70% of
incoming heat to prevent it from
overheating you also find them in huge
numbers where the grass is very very
good for wildebeest known for their
great migration where vast numbers
search for food and water between
Tanzania and Kenya in the summer time
five baboons extremely intelligent
social playful and smart monkeys who
have hair on both sides of their face
and large hairless butts that may turn
red 6 buffalo large heads broad chests
and 4 times stronger than an ox can be
vicious
and are reported to kill more hunters in
Africa than any other animal 7 African
spoonbill feed in shallow water has
fallen phibian fish and insects uses its
open bill to catch food by swinging it
from side to side in the water eight
kudu beautiful antelope one of the
largest that we have easily recognized
by its long spiral horns that can reach
72 inches long known for its athleticism
and fence jumping abilities 9 vervet
monkey these small black faced monkeys
are omnivores meaning they eat both
plants and meat spend most of their time
living in trees laid by dominant males
the government and they lead from the
government with one prime minister can
lyon generally very lazy animal live in
large groups called prides can weigh up
to 500 pounds and a male's roar can be
heard from up to five miles away both
male and females do the hunting 11 hippo
live mostly in water to protect their
skin from the sun's reputation for
causing the most human fatalities 12
white backed vulture very important bird
to the whole ecosystem Africa's most
common large vulture is a scavenger that
feeds on the carcasses of large animals
13 in Halle an antelope that inhabits
dry savannas in dense woodlands usually
seen alone or in packs of two or three
and only found in the southeastern parts
of Africa 14 in dung beetle not many
people know that there's over 800
species of dung beetles in Africa very
important for the ecosystem because they
roll elephant dung into a ball and bury
it which put nutrients back into the
ground and also allows females to lay
her eggs
15 chameleons their tongue can reach
grasshoppers crickets and insects in
point zero 7 split seconds they can
change colors to camouflage and their
eyes rotate separately on 180 degree art
16 leopard tortoise spent most of its
time grazing on grasslands can live up
to 75 years any tortoise that we have in
Africa that consume 17 leopard
light-colored with dark spots can run up
to 58 kilometers per hour and eat
animals such as Impala and wildebeest 18
rock monitor lizard the second longest
African lizard reaching 2 metres in
length they are fearsome predators
hunting on and under the ground in trees
and in water 19 kori bustard Africa's
heaviest flying bird which can weigh up
to 19 kilograms and reach 3 feet tall
their diet is mostly based on insects
snakes lizards and small mammals 20 in
giant land snail they can live up to 10
years with a huge shell reaching up to
eight inches in length
[Music]
there are plenty more animals I've seen
over the last week but I had to pick and
choose my favorites to share with you I
hope this video spreads a positive
message that all animals living in our
ecosystem are amazing
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
videos please click Subscribe and join
me as I plan to visit every country in
the world
